dialogue: How can I help you?
Comamos.
My apologies about the viper. He’s there for security, of course.
Security?
From prowlers. Coming after my research. I assume they told you about it in Quito?
Yes. Of course. Or, well, they didn’t give me all the details.
Why did you say you boys came out here?
We wanted to ask you... about the vegetation in the area.
The vegetation?
I suppose I would be the right person to ask about that.
Can I ask about the bowl?
The bowl? Lee points to it. Cotter frowns slightly, looks at him.
It’s for a healing ceremony... involving a brew that’s made from one of the plants in the area.
Yage?
Maybe out here it’s called Ayahuasca? I’ve heard that the Russians and the Americans are using it for different experiments. The truth is that’s why we came out here.
I think there might be a buck in it if someone could bring it back to the West. I want to investigate the properties of this drug. I’d be willing to take some... as an experiment. We both would.
Yage is connected to brujeria. Witchcraft. To get some, you’d have to develop a relationship with the local brujo. It would take you years to gain his confidence.
Do you have that confidence?
I’ve been out here for a long time.
The boys must be tired, no?
Yes. I imagine they are.
I thank you again for the supplies. Let me show you where you’ll sleep.
I guess you can both make out here.
Mosquitoes?
No. Vampire bats.
Goodnight.
She has it, don’t you think?
We’re close.
Your friend’s already up having coffee with hubby.
Why don’t you take this and explore the area today. Try and kill us something we can eat tonight.
Tell the truth now. Are you boys really just here for Yage?
I appreciate the supplies you brought, but if I welcome you into my home and I find you trying to run off with my research, I’ll kill you and dump you in the jungle. No one will miss you out here.
Doc, With all due respect, I couldn’t give two shits about your research. I already forgot everything you told me about it.
You know it doesn’t get you high, right? Not like you’re used to. I’m a medical doctor. I can spot a junky from a mile away.
I’m not interested in getting high.
Then what are you interested in?
Telepathy.
There’s this Shuar Myth, The Fox and the Jaguar. You ever hear of it?

Real old story. You boys reminded me of it. There’s this fox, right? And he deceives a jaguar into making love the way two males of a species make love. When the jaguar looks behind him and realizes what’s happening, he gets this big smile on his face and he chases the fox all around the jungle and bites him. Doesn’t kill him or anything -- just kind of gives him a nibble.

You see, the Indians out here have no real conception of the sort of thing that’s going on between the two of you. The Spanish tried to convince them a couple centuries ago that it was evil and all that nonsense, but the idea never really caught on. For them, it’s more about being a trickster. Like children playing a game.
So which one of you is the fox and which one is the jaguar?
I’ll help you.
Banisteriopsis caapi. The Indians call it Yage.
I, I, I, I, I, I, I / I am like Tsunki / When I take Yage / My body becomes cold / I, I, I, I, I / I am sitting with Tsunki
You feel anything?
